DOC.detailed_description: The investigator conduct Stage 1 pilot feasibility study McLean Hospital develop refine Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ( CBT ) intervention . Twelve subject ( 50 % female , age 18-65 ) meet Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders 4th edition ( DSM-IV ) criterion marijuana nicotine dependence seek treatment stop use marijuana tobacco receive individual CBT aim treat disorder , well Nicotine Replacement Therapy ( NRT ) form transdermal nicotine patch . Subjects start 21-mg nicotine patch 6 week , follow taper 14-mg nicotine patch 2 week , finally , 7-mg nicotine patch 2 week . Others start 14-mg patch 8 week follow 7-mg patch 2 week . All participant receive 10 week 1-hour weekly CBT experience clinician . Follow-up visit , schedule 4 , 6 , 8 , 10 week , evaluate durability treatment effect drug use psychosocial outcome .
